summary: This bill, the Rural Health Clinic Location Modernization Act of 2025, aims to amend the Social Security Act to update the standards for rural health clinics under the Medicare program. It proposes changing the definition of an "urban area" used in the qualification criteria, replacing "urbanized area" with "urban area" having a population of 50,000 or more. The changes are scheduled to take effect on January 1, 2027.
